text: Brokskat is a Dardic language spoken in Ladakh, India and Gilgit-Baltistan, Pakistan. {cite official recognition} url= https://cdnbbsr.s3waas.gov.in/s395192c98732387165bf8e396c0f2dad2/uploads/2022/09/2022091657.pdf It is spoken by the Dard people in lower Indus Valley of Ladakh and Baltistan. Brokskat/Dardiarya is a branch of the Shina languages spoken in northern Pakistan. ==References== Category:Dardic languages Category:Languages of India Category:Languages of Gilgit-Baltistan
title: Brokskat
